description: This file implements the core functions for an 'Ansc Broker Socket Tcp Object' in C, including creation, removal, object enrollment, and initialization. It defines mechanisms to instantiate, initialize, and destroy socket objects for an advanced networking service, and contains functions with detailed comments explaining object lifecycle management and socket handling.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE AnscBktoCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs a new instance of the Ansc Broker Socket Tcp Object, initializing its properties and function pointers.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscBktoRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the socket object, closing and resetting it, and freeing associated resources.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscBktoEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enlists required subordinate objects or components needed by this socket object.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS AnscBktoInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Performs the initialization of the socket object, setting default values and preparing it for use.
